alert.note: Alert for Campbell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL CAMPBELL, CLERMONT AND NORTHWESTERN BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over New Richmond, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Alexandria, Forestville, Amelia, Mount Orab, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Batavia, Withamsville, Owensville, Goshen, Newtonsville, Mentor, Moscow, California, Chasetown, Perintown, Saltair, Day Heights and New Palestine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
